And as soon as They started to do that, we started to roll video on it, and we allowed the actor to continue to step on my stuff.  Not a problem, I've had people kick stuff over before.  That sign is actually pretty indestructible.  You know, it's made of really good materials.  And as soon as the actor went to grab it and said, you know, basically I'm taking this sign, that's when I intervene.  So I actually allowed the actor to do that up until the point they started to walk away with it, with the sign.

Joining me now is Dion Cheney.  He's the Trump supporter seen in a recent video that went viral.  Dion, thanks for being here with me.  So I want to talk about what happened.  So first of all, let's go over where this all went down.  You were standing in front of Trump Tower in New York City, and you had a giant Trump banner.  You had your Trump hat on.  What were you doing out there?

Sure.  I'm out there once a week for about the last two years.  So this is nothing new.  I'm not a new... you know, a new site there on Fifth Avenue.  So people have been coming by and saying hello for, like I said, over two years.  So this is just another daily event that I do, you know, rowing or traveling with the Trump bag.  So something that I just, I enjoy doing.
You were standing there and was it somebody that you recognized came up to you and took your Trump banner?

Yeah, well, first the actor came up and started asking questions.  like normally, you know, a lot of the leftists come over, what do you like about Trump?  What has he done for America?  How has he made America great?  Answered a couple of questions.  And then, of course, they didn't like the questions that we're answering.  And then we said, you know, a couple of us said that, you know, we're a fan.  We are a fan of your show.  And it didn't like that very much.

So in this video, I'm going to play the video right now.  It shows them trying to steal your sign.  There are two people in this video, the actress, which goes by the name of Indy Moore.  And so Indy Moore and another man are seen kind of grabbing your sign, and then you're telling them to put it down, and they're not listening to you.  Here, I'm going to play it right now.  So she's pulling the sign and begins to stomp on it.  And you're pushing back.  Sure.  So while you're asking for your stuff back, they refuse to give it back to you, and then the actress knocks your hat off.
Yep.
And then the police intervene.

Well, we can actually go back because before the video started, obviously, there was some disturbance.  You know, the actor, I had my stuff set up, and I don't know if you could show a picture of maybe what it actually looks like when I do there every day.  Not every day, once a week.  I had everything set up.  The actor dragged all my stuff, the sign and my bike, into the center of the sidewalk.  That's the part you didn't see.  And as soon as they started to do that, we started to roll video on it.  And we allowed the actor to continue to step on my stuff.  Not a problem.  I've had people kick stuff over before.  That sign is actually pretty indestructible.  You know, it's made of really good materials.  And as soon as the actor went to grab it and said, you know, basically I'm taking this sign, that's when I intervene.  So I actually allowed the actor to do that up until the point they started to walk away with it, with the son.

Okay, and just to be clear, this is a transgender actor, this India Moore, and she went to Twitter.  She's playing the victim right now.  She says, Thank you for loving my community, fighting for us, supporting us, fight for ourselves and others who are experiencing an increase of oppression and violence under this current administration.  And I noticed that she was playing the victim in this video as well.  When the police came in, when they stepped in, she started to blame you as if it were your fault that they decided to take your property.

Sure.  So you're talking about larceny because everything is worth more than $300.  You're talking about forcible robbery.  And then when you commit the crime, what really was, as soon as they took this stuff and I grabbed onto it and pulled it back, as soon as they resisted, then it actually became assault against me, not against them.  And also the fact that they instigated it.  So they instigated everything.  They forcibly robbed me.  They committed larceny.  And other acts that you can clearly see in the video.  But yeah, I actually knew that the left-wing media was actually going to come out this way and actually blame me for everything, because that's the same exact thing that they do for Trump.

So, you know, I didn't see any video of what happened before the incident.  So you're saying you were just standing there, minding your own business, exercising your First Amendment rights, supporting President Trump, and then they came up to you, started asking you questions, didn't like what you had to say, and then they thought it would be okay to stomp on your property and try to take

it.  Yeah, I guess.  Like I said, it's a first for me.  I've had people kick it over, but to actually just take it and walk away with it, I didn't know what they would do with it.  You just can't throw it in the trash.  It's pretty big.  Maybe they wanted to take it home and do show and tell, put it on the internet.  Look what I took from a Trump supporter.  I'm just wondering why.  they thought they could take something without repercussion.  I actually just think it's the mentality of the entire generation, or most of them.  Entitlement.
You said that there were police officers around, so they witnessed the whole thing?

Yeah, police officers witnessed everything from start to finish from across the street.  It's a clear shot across the street.  They came over in about 35 seconds, but they did see everything.  So they did see the actor instigate the entire situation, not me.  Like I said, I'm out there once a week.  I say we're just nice people.  We love Trump.  And yeah, from time to time, people will be somewhat aggressive, but nothing like that.
So, I mean, you know how liberal New York City is.  You could kind of predict that this type of stuff might happen to you.  It shouldn't, but you know that it's very possible.

No, of course not.  No, of course not.  But I also when the media says you shouldn't you should be afraid of liberals.  I just disagree with that.  And obviously, as shown as shown last Friday, you don't have to be afraid of them.  No, it wasn't really.  it didn't really take a lot of effort to get my stuff back.  But yeah, I just living in New York City and and doing what I'm doing.  I actually say it's called being normal.  Supporting my president is normal.  I see a lot of people hate Trump.  But I don't see anybody supporting Biden or Warren or any other candidates.  And I often ask myself, why?  So just because they don't want to stand for something and support a candidate is not going to stop me, no matter where I am.
Some people might criticize you for being aggressive in the situation or maybe would say, oh, you should have just walked away from it.  What do you say to those who would make?

Absolutely not.  Absolutely not.  No, it's larceny.  It's forcible robbery.  and instigation.  and no, absolutely not.  When I'm out there on the streets of New York, you have two options as a spectator.  You can look or you can just turn around and just keep walking.  Any other option, you know, you can ask questions, you can be nice, but any other option except those two options is usually going to turn out a crime for the person who, you know, wants to do whatever they want to do when they're coming by.  So look or don't look.  That's it.  It's really that simple.

Yeah, so it sounds to me like you're trying to make two points here.  Number one, you have the right to exercise your First Amendment rights by supporting a duly elected president out on the streets.  And number two, you're a Trump supporter and you're going to fight back.

Sure.  Well, you know, you just... You can say whatever you want to me when I'm out there on the streets.  Just don't try to rob me.  That's all I ask.  So say whatever you like.  You can scream.  You can yell.  Don't spit.  Don't punch.  Don't steal anything.  Just say what you have to say.  That is the actual First Amendment.  There is no amendment that says you can just take other people's property while somebody else is invoking the First Amendment.
Walk us to the point where the actress began to play victim when the police officers were trying to break up what was going on.

The crazy thing was, I mean, I was listening to it, and you can hear part of it.  The actor actually told the police, I took the sign because he's a Trump supporter, and I don't want Trump supporters to be a fan of my show.  I mean, just telling a police officer something like that is basically saying, I committed a crime.  take me to jail.  You know, they didn't arrest the person on the spot.  We still have investigations ongoing.  Something might happen, something might not.  It all depends on, you know, hopefully this does, I don't want this to escalate, but if it does escalate on their end, then I'll have to take action.
So you did file a police report?
Yeah, I filed an initial police report without arrest.  It's my option to do a police report with arrest, based on the content of the video.
Why wouldn't you ask for arrest?

You know, I've been doing this so long and out there every day.  I don't know.  It can come back.  It could, something could happen.  Something else could happen. Right now, the video, and I've been on the, even the left wing media, you know, sites, I've been reading the thread.  You know, Dion did what he had to do to stand his ground.  Yeah.  So most of the, most of those stories that are coming out, like you guys are just, you guys are crazy.  It's just fake news.

Yeah, I read a couple stories that it was fascinating because if you watch the video, it's pretty clear what happened.  But TheRoot.com wrote this title.  It says, It's extremely misleading.  And when you look through the rest of their article, I mean, they even posted the video.  Clearly, you weren't attacking.  You were fighting back and trying to get your property back.
